parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUTRT

fields.definition: The type of substance (e.g., TOBACCO, ALCOHOL, CAFFEINE or CIGARETTES, CIGARS, COFFEE).
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsors may require different types of substance use data (e.g., illicit drug use, cigarettes); the value for category may be preprinted on the CRF as a label for the prompt for Substance Use. If a more detailed type of substance appears on the CRF (e.g., CIGARETTES, CIGARS rather than TOBACCO), SUCAT should be TOBACCO and SUTRT should be CIGARETTES.
fields.label: Reported Name of Substance
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUTRT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the Substance Used category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology (e.g., TOBACCO, ALCOHOL, CAFFEINE). Sponsors may require different types of substance use data (e.g., illicit drug use, cigarettes); the value for category may be preprinted on the CRF. If a more detailed type of substance appears on the CRF (e.g., CIGARETTES, CIGARS, rather than TOBACCO), SUCAT is TOBACCO and SUTRT is CIGARETTES. If the sponsor does not specify a type of tobacco on the CRF, SUTRT is TOBACCO. If SUCAT is not collected (e.g. it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process.
fields.label: Category for Substance Use
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUCAT
fields.questionText: What is/was the category of the substance (used)?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the Substance Use subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the SUCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. The value for subcategory may be preprinted on the CRF or hidden. SUSCAT can only be used if there is a SUCAT and it must be a subcategorization of SUCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Substance Use
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the substance (used)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUPRESP

fields.definition: An indication that a specific intervention or a group of interventions is prespecified on a CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: For prespecified interventions, a hidden field on a CRF defaulted to Y, or added during the SDTM dataset creation. If a study collects both prespecified interventions as well as free-text interventions, the value of SUPRESP should be Y for all prespecified interventions and null for interventions reported as free-text.
fields.label: SU prespecified
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUPRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUYN

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject had used any (sponsor-defined phrase/recreational drugs/alcohol/substance name).
fields.definition: An indication whether or not any data was collected for the intervention topic.
fields.implementationNotes: General prompt question to aid in monitoring and data cleaning. This provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. This is a field that can be used on any interventions CRF to indicate whether or not there is data to record.
fields.label: Any Substance Used
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: SUYN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78738
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C83004

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUNCF

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point
Start Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Check the appropriate box to indicate if the subject has ever used/consumed tobacco/alcohol/caffeine, currently consumes tobacco/alcohol/caffeine, or formerly used/consumed tobacco/alcohol/caffeine.
fields.definition: Indication the prespecified substance was used.
fields.implementationNotes:
The 3 options (NEVER, CURRENT, FORMER) are sponsor-defined in relation to the protocol. If the sponsor has specific definitions, these definitions are detailed in the instructions to the site. As this type of response does not correspond exactly to an SDTM variable, CDASH recommends using the CDASHIG variable SUNCF. Sponsors must decide how to populate the appropriate relative timing variables when the SDTM-based datasets are created. For example, If SUNCF ="Never", the value of SUOCCUR will be "N" and all relative timing variables will be null. If the sponsor chooses to populate the relative start references (SUSTRTPT, SUSTRF) the value will be "BEFORE" when SUNCF= "CURRENT" and "FORMER". If the sponsor also chooses to use relative end references (SUENRF, SUENRTPT) , the SUENRTPT value will be "ONGOING" when SUNCF="CURREN" while the value of SUENRF will be "DURING/AFTER". 
 Note: When using SUSTRTPT and/or SUENRTPT, these must refer to a "time point anchor" such as SCREENING in SUSTTPT/SUENTPT.
fields.label: Never Current Former Usage
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate SUOCCUR and relative timing variables.
fields.name: SUNCF

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUSPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
fields.implementationNotes: Since SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Substance Use Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: SUSPID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUREASND

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason why the substance used data were not collected.
fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (e.g., subject refused) or entered as free text. When PRREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PRSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: Reason Substance Use Not Collected
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUREASND
fields.questionText: What was the reason the data was not collected?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUDSTXT

fields.completionInstructions: Check the appropriate box to indicate the amount of tobacco/alcohol/caffeine the subject consumes on a regular basis.
fields.definition: The amount of substance used (e.g., 1-2 packs, 8 ounces).
fields.implementationNotes: Where possible, the options for dose/amount are preprinted on the CRF. In the example given in the Definition, (packs) and (ounces) are included as a point of reference. They would, of course, be submitted as SUDOSU. Care should be taken to map each record to the appropriate SDTM variable SUDOSTXT (text results that cannot be represented in a numeric field) and SUDOSE (numeric results).
fields.label: Substance Dose Description
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to SUDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., 200-400) map to SUDOSTXT in SDTM.
fields.name: SUDSTXT
fields.questionText: What is/was the amount of [SUTRT] used/consumed?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71113

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUDOSFRQ

fields.completionInstructions: Record how often the subject regularly [uses / consumes] (the) [substance].
fields.definition: The number/amount of the of substance consumed per a specific interval.
fields.implementationNotes: When possible, the options for dose/amount frequency are preprinted on the CRF. (e.g., PER DAY, PER WEEK, OCCASIONAL).
fields.label: Substance Use Frequency per Interval
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUDOSFRQ

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUSTDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the start date of the substance use using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date substance use started, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The sponsor may choose to capture a complete date or any variation thereof (e.g., month and year, year).
fields.label: Substance Use Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SUSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: SUSTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the start date of [SUTRT/SUCAT] use/consumption?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUENDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the end date of the substance use using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date substance use ended, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The sponsor may choose to capture a complete date or any variation thereof (e.g., month and year, year).
fields.label: Substance Use End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SUENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: SUENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the end date of [SUTRT/SUCAT] use/consumption?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUCDUR

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the duration of the substance use (e.g., Record how long the subject has smoked).
fields.definition: Collected duration of the substance use.
fields.implementationNotes: This is only collected on the CRF if this level of detail is needed and if SUSTDAT and SUENDAT are not collected on the CRF.
fields.label: Substance Use Collected Duration
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM-based dataset, concatenating the CDASH collected duration and collected duration unit and populate the SDTMIG variable SUDUR in ISO 8601 format. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).
fields.name: SUCDUR
fields.questionText: What was the duration of [SUTRT/SUCAT] use/consumption?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUCDURU

fields.completionInstructions: Select the appropriate duration unit of the substance use.
fields.definition: Unit of the collected duration of the substance use. Used only if duration was collected on the CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: The sponsor-defined options should be preprinted on the CRF to avoid making this a free text field. This will allow the response to be translated into ISO 8601 format.
fields.label: Substance Use Collected Duration Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM-based dataset, concatenating the CDASH collected duration and collected duration unit and populate the SDTMIG variable SUDUR in ISO 8601 format. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).
fields.name: SUCDURU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of duration of [SUTRT/SUCAT] use/consumption?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUMODIFY

fields.definition: If the value for SUTERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
fields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. If the sponsor chooses to code the substance use, the sponsor will populate this through the coding process.
fields.label: Modified Substance Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUMODIFY

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Substance Use Dictionary or Standardized Term

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field SU.SUDECOD

fields.definition: The dictionary or sponsor-defined standardized text description of SUTRT, or the modified topic variable (SUMODIFY), if applicable.
fields.implementationNotes: This is typically not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. If the sponsor chooses to code the substance use, the sponsor will populate this through the coding process. Equivalent to the generic drug name in WHODrug, or a term in SNOMED, ICD9, or other published or sponsor-defined dictionaries. If SUPRESP is used, and the information about a specific standardized substance name is being solicited, the data from SUTRT may map directly to the SDTMIG SUDECOD variable.
fields.label: Standardized Substance Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
fields.name: SUDECOD
